title: Pet Subjects: 'Grey squirrels are devouring the feed I leave out for birds. How do I stop them?'
text:
Dear Pete

Our treasured senior pug, called Mussolini, develops spasms of his back legs, especially when walking on gravel. He gets better quickly and he does not seem to be in pain, just uncomfortable. Can we massage him, or is there medication that might help?

PM, Belfast

Dear PM

This sounds like a focal seizure or a movement disorder. Intermittent problems like this are challenging for vets: when a patient is normal on examination, it’s hard to work out what’s wrong. Use your phone to take a video of an episode, and show your vet. If a specific diagnosis can be made, daily medication may help. Meanwhile, yes, massage may help: a book titled Physical Therapy and Massage for the Dog by Julia...
